item.title: Why GTA 6's Exciting Buildings Leak Should Be Taken With a Grain of Salt
item.description:
Grand Theft Auto 6 has continued to be a hot bed for leaks and rumors. The anticipation surrounding Rockstar's next project is no joke, and while rumors surrounding Grand Theft Auto 6 are compelling, they should always be taken with a hefty grain of salt. After years of speculation, gamers have gotten brief glimpses into GTA 6 and its story, but many of the finer details still remain a mystery, which makes the game fertile soil for more speculation to grow.

The GTA 6 rumor mill has been busy as of late. One of the most recent leaks comes from a now-deleted Reddit post that claimed around 67% of the in-game buildings would allow players to enter them. This is a fascinating thought, of course, but if GTA 6 really does have such a bold feature, it may not be as ambitious as the leak suggests.

GTA 6 is currently set to launch on May 26, 2026.

GTA 6's New Building Leak Could Be Setting Up False Expectations

The World of GTA 6 is Going Bigger Than Ever Before

It's already known that Rockstar is making one of its biggest worlds yet with GTA 6 . The centerpiece of Vice City and the greater state of Leonida are already expanding the scope of what a GTA game can hold. With so many different areas confirmed for GTA 6 , the claim that 67% of the buildings can be entered is incredibly bold. As of now, there's no way to know for sure if these supposed leaks hold any actual weight, but if they do, there are bound to be some technicalities to consider before the game gets here.

Even if 67% of buildings can be entered, that doesn't mean that every section can be reached. This leak makes it sound as though players will be able to enter every single room, floor, and area within a building, and this is highly unlikely to actually be the case. Instead, it's more probable that players can enter lobbies, rooftops, or even various rooms in certain sections, but actually making the majority of buildings entirely explorable definitely seems far-fetched. Many eager for GTA 6 are taking any new information they can get, even if fresh leaks and rumors seem too good to be true. It's simply fun to speculate on what the game has in store, but this could also be setting some up for disappointment.

The anticipation surrounding Rockstar's next project is no joke, and while rumors surrounding Grand Theft Auto 6 are compelling, they should always be taken with a hefty grain of salt.

The Hype Surrounding GTA 6 Risks Backfiring

Right now, there is less than a year away until GTA 6 is finally here, and the expectations are enormous. As each new leak rises to the surface, some may be getting a false idea about what the game is like before Rockstar has even offered a gameplay preview. After the wild launch of Hollow Knight: Silksong , it's clear that GTA 6 is going to cause even more of a frenzy, but the majority of potential players are hopefully keeping expectations in check.

GTA 6 stars the franchise's first male/female duo with protagonists Jason and Lucia.

There's no doubt that GTA 6 is going to be a historic release, but the amount of leaks and rumors circulating may ultimately be doing a disservice. When leaks feature such interesting info, it's really hard not to get one's hopes up.

As the months continue to pass, only time will tell what Rockstar has up its sleeve with GTA 6 . With less than a year away, the hype is reaching a fever pitch, and while the thought of 67% of buildings being explorable is intriguing, it's unlikely to be an accurate portrait of this kind of feature.

item.title: Best RPGs With Intense Combat
item.description:
Role-playing games usually feature a combat focus to keep fans engaged. Players love the idea of whooping people to smithereens as they use a bevy of combat techniques to leave enemies with no hope of surviving.

The combat in these games is either cathartic, tense, or both. Either way, players will love mastering the combat mechanics and feeling a sense of satisfaction as they surpass seemingly insurmountable obstacles without breaking a sweat.

8 Cyberpunk 2077

The Action In This Game Is Off The Charts

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
116
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 's combat was already great enough as is, even if the weapon mechanics could have done with some work. Now, with the improvements of Update 2.0, this game is more fun to play than ever before.

Leaping into battle with a katana, jumping from a height using Berserk, and utilizing a wealth of iconic weapons ensures that combat remains fresh. Quickhacks are also dynamic and allow players to broaden the wealth of options at their disposal in fun and intense battles where players can't spam heals anymore to brute force their way through encounters.

7 Yakuza 0

The Crunchy Combat And Intense Boss Fights Make For A Great Time

10 Images
10 Images
Yakuza 0
8.5 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Yakuza 0 is the perfect introduction for fans to this series, with both Kiryu and Majima boasting a total of six (well, eight if players complete the optional content) unique combat styles players can use to great effect. The battles against regular goons are a great way for players to flex their skills against relatively easy enemies.

However, the bosses in this game are where the intensity reaches new heights. Seeing the amazing dynamic intros to bosses that will push the protagonists to their very limits never gets old, even with the ability to down healing items at any moment.

6 Darkest Dungeon

Combat Is Stressful And Becomes Very Nerve-Wracking When Things Go South

Darkest Dungeon
9 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Darkest Dungeon is one of the toughest turn-based RPGs players can get their hands on. This indie game wastes no time in making players aware of just how helpless they are in the face of overwhelming odds over and over again.

The intense battles see players trying to survive instead of winning. Tactical decisions must be made to safeguard heroes who carry the party while sacrificing others who are more disposable, which can make things seem hopeless until the stars finally align for players and they slowly but surely start making progress.

5 Divinity: Original Sin 2

Players Will Agonize Over The Decisions They Make In Every Combat Turn

Divinity: Original Sin 2
8.6 /10
Released
September 14, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Compared to the first game, Original Sin 2 is way more challenging because of the Physical and Magical Armor added to the game. Instead of just relying on RNG to apply status effects, players must now ensure that their party members are equipped to the nines and specialize in either physical or magical combat.

This made combat more tactical and intense than ever, with a single mistake leading to the player's demise. The first and last Acts are the most difficult ones of the lot and will force players to be nigh-perfect in combat.

4 Bloodborne

The Fast-Paced Combat Of This Game Is Exhilarating And Challenging In Equal Measure

6 Images
6 Images
Bloodborne
22
9.1 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

Unlike Dark Souls and its sequel, Bloodborne adopted a faster combat system that served this game well. Battles were more intense than ever as players had to rely on swift reflexes and a ton of aggression to survive the game's tough monsters and relentless bosses.

The game actively encourages players to take risks and restore lost health by attacking right after getting hit, which turns combat into an intense dance that can be harrowing to deal with. However, this also makes mastery so satisfying as players eventually wipe out bosses who were giving them a tough time.

3 STALKER: Clear Sky

The Firefights In This Game Are Off The Charts

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky
7.5 /10
Released
September 15, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Violence
Powered by

The hardest game in the STALKER series features one of the toughest video game beginnings of all time, where players will die over and over again. After a grueling few hours, players can finally venture into the open world... and get ripped apart by mutants or shot at by raiders in no time.

Combat is stressful as players try to survive harrowing encounters without dying or incurring a billion wounds. This can be a nightmare to deal with, but the satisfaction of exploring and making progress ensures that players will try their hardest to match the game's intensity as much as they can.

2 Hogwarts Legacy

Combat Opens Up As Players Get Spells And Obliterate Their Foes

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
77
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Hogwarts Legacy may falter in some departments, but the combat never lets up. Every spell expands the wealth of options in a player's arsenal, eventually allowing them to pull off incredible spell combos in battle.

This is a must, given that combat becomes so hard that timely casting Protego and taking out enemies as quickly as possible becomes more exhilarating than ever. In fact, most people would argue that the battles of Hogwarts Legacy are so intense that they single-handedly carry the experience to the very end.

1 Fear & Hunger

An Unforgiving RPG Where Players Must Bring Their A-game In Combat

6 Images
6 Images
Fear & Hunger
Horror
RPG
Systems
Released
December 11, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Adults Only
Powered by

Fear & Hunger is one of the toughest RPGs of all time, where the first battle players get into makes it clear just how unfair this title is. Wolves will tear enemies apart, giants will smash enemies to smithereens, and the less said about the Crow Mauler, the better.

Every battle is a sweaty affair as players try to take out enemies quickly and minimize damage. Most people would outright avoid enemy encounters as much as they can to ensure that their run goes for as long as it possibly can.

item.title: How to Awaken Pain in Blox Fruits
item.description:
Pain is definitely one of the more unusual fruits in Blox Fruits . This is because its abilities involve taking damage for various bonuses. To get the most out of this high-risk, high-reward gameplay, you'll want to upgrade all of its abilities to the max. This guide will go through the details of how to awaken Pain in Blox Fruits .

Unlike most other fruits in this Roblox RPG, Pain is upgraded in a specific way. You'll have to complete certain quests before you can upgrade the fruit to the max.

How to Awaken Pain in Blox Fruits

Once you have the Pain Fruit and have earned enough Mastery to unlock all the moves, you will want to upgrade them. To awaken the Pain Fruit in Blox Fruits , you will need to use the Admin Panel. This device belongs to the Mysterious Scientist, who will gladly allow you to use it.

Each move requires research, namely the completion of a certain quest. Only after completing it will you be able to awaken the fruit's move in exchange for resources.

Where to Find the Mysterious Scientist NPC

The Mysterious Scientist has several locations. You can find him in both the Second Sea and the Third Sea. However, in the Third Sea, he is located in a much easier location.

  • Second Sea - Mysterious Scientist is located in the laboratory in Hot and Cold. He is hidden behind a secret door that can be opened by pressing the correct colored buttons, namely Red, Blue, Green, and Blue.
  • Third Sea - You will find him in the Safe Zone on Castle on the Sea island.

Pain Awakening Requirements

After you find the Mysterious Scientist, you will be able to use the Admin Panel to awaken the Pain fruit in Blox Fruits . It is important to note that you will first need to complete the requirements for each move to upgrade it. Here's what they are exactly, all condensed into a handy table:

Ability

Requirement

Mastery

Cost

Infernal Endurance

You need to walk on lava for 5 minutes.

Magma Ore

2 Ectoplasm

1,000 Fragments

Agony Surge

Collect 5 Pain orbs at once using the Self Repel ability.

4 Ectoplasm

2,500 Fragments

Torment Conductor

Beat a Lightning user

400

5 Ectoplasm

Nightmare Catcher

6,000 Fragments

Spectral Assimilation

Collect 200 Pain orbs

500

5 Ectoplasm

3 Nightmare Catchers

9,500 Fragments

item.title: Future Indiana Jones Stories Should Borrow Order of Giants' Melting Pot Approach
item.description:
This article contains MAJOR SPOILERS for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's DLC.

The Indiana Jones franchise has dipped its toes into many different mythologies and historical concepts over the last four decades. From Christianity to Hinduism, Egyptian mythology, and even less-grounded Sci-Fi concepts like interdimensional flight and time travel. And that's just the mainline movies. The Indiana Jones expanded universe goes much further.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle features a familiar source material at its core, but presents it in a new light, with Indy embarking on a quest to track down a series of religious artifacts located in some of the world's most important historical sites. The recently released The Order of Giants DLC offers a much shorter, mostly standalone adventure that takes place right at the beginning of Indy's Great Circle quest, and its subject matter should lay the blueprint for every Indiana Jones story to come.

Indiana Jones: The Order of Giants Is a Melting Pot of Mythology

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's The Order of Giants DLC begins with the titular protagonist hunting for the helmet of 'The Nameless Crusader' underneath the Vatican. Indy finds the helmet, along with an assortment of other artifacts and relics from the Crusades. The Nameless Crusader's story continues in his tomb hidden in Rome's Cloaca Maxima, which is filled with more Christian imagery, along with murals of the Garden of Eden and other Biblical moments.

Indiana Jones: The Order of Giants then goes on to dip its toes into Greek mythology, which is somewhat rare for the franchise. Players find historical letters discussing Ancient Roman Emperor Nero's new champion in the gladiatorial pits. This "giant" warrior came from Greece, where he was given the nickname the 'Monster of Crete'. It's heavily implied that this warrior is the origin of the Minotaur myth, with him wearing heavy armor and a bull's head helmet when fighting.

The Order of Giants even has a dash of Roman/Iranian mythology as well. Towards the end of the DLC, it's revealed that there's a secret cult operating underneath Rome. Known as the 'Cult of Mithras', this group worships the eponymous ancient Roman/Iranian god Mithras, who was often associated with the sun, war, and justice.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle 's Cult of Mithras believe that they need to open the 'Monster Gate' found deep inside the Cloaca Maxima, using the cylindrical keys found in each of the giants' tombs. Once the gate is open, they believe they'll find a "sacred bull" inside who must be sacrificed using the Dagger of Mithras. Its sacrifice is said to bring enlightenment to the perpetrator.

Future Indiana Jones Stories Shouldn't Be Afraid to Mix Mythologies

Generally speaking, most Indiana Jones stories tend to focus on one mythology, concept, or core aspect of ancient history. This helps to keep the story easily digestible for general audiences, and allows the creators to dive deep into their chosen source material. But while this solo mythology approach makes a lot of sense, it isn't quite as exciting as Indiana Jones: The Order of Giants ' melting pot approach.

Mixing several mythologies together like The Order of Giants does with its Monster of Crete who came to fight in Rome's Colosseum helps to make the adventure feel even grander in scope. If the artifact or person in question is so important that they're baked into the DNA of multiple ancient religions and historical civilizations, then it must be truly legendary.

item.title: Borderlands 4: What Are Ordnance Weapons?
item.description:
Ordnance is a new addition to Borderlands 4 , bringing forth a new skill for all players that will unleash even deeper layers of buildcrafting and mayhem. As players jump into Kairos and fight against the Rippers and Order alike, it's going to be essential to know everything on offer, including that of Ordnance weapons. These powerhouses can make every boss fight a breeze, so long as players know what they are, the types of Ordnance players can find, and why they're worth investing in.

All Ordnance Weapon Types in Borderlands 4

Ordnance is split into two categories: Grenades and Heavy Weapons. Below, we've compiled the Ordnance weapons that players can come across in their own worlds:

Weapon Type

Ordnance Type

How it Works

Light Machine Gun

Heavy Weapon

Hold the trigger to make the barrels shoot faster, expunging more ammo but increasing DPS.

Rocket Launcher

Heavy Weapon

Hold the trigger for faster-firing rockets for deadly explosives, just be mindful of using it up close.

Plasma Cannon

Heavy Weapon

Hold the trigger to see a crackling beam stick to enemies for ticking damage.

Grenade

Grenade

Throw to see an explosive effect, which changes depending on the weapon manufacturer, meaning it might be an impact grenade, a splash grenade, or even a delayed one.

Throwing Knife

Grenade

Throw to see this projectile stab enemies, where aiming for heads and other critical hit spots will provide more damage.

What Are Ordnance Weapons?

Ordnance weapons are separate from the primary 4 weapons in your main slots, and instead, have their own dedicated slot. Players can activate their Ordnance weapon with R1/RB/G, which will equip them with the Ordnance weapon. These weapons have a cooldown upon use, which can range from a few seconds to well over 45 seconds, depending on the type of weapon equipped and how much ammo was used. The Ordnance slot is reserved for Grenades and Heavy Weapons, and cannot be fired during Fight for Your Life. However, Ordnance weapons deal immense damage, can come with Firmware (after Level 25), and even have dedicated Skills to invest into for each Vault Hunter to boost their power.
